words.definition: You use although to say that one thing is contrasted by another.
words.example: Although she was late, her friends gave her a warm welcome.

words.definition: To apply something means to put it on.
words.example: She always applies makeup to her face before going outside.

words.definition: To await something means to wait for it.
words.example: The players awaited the judgeâ€™s decision.

words.definition: When something is beloved, it is very special and you like it very much.
words.example: The boy took a nap next to his beloved cat.

words.definition: To bury means to put something in the ground and cover it with earth.
words.example: The dog buried his bone in the yard.

words.definition: Climate is the usual weather conditions of a place.
words.example: Mexico has a warm climate.

words.definition: To complain means to say that you are not happy about something.
words.example: The customers complained about the slow service.

words.definition: To confuse someone means to make them unable to think clearly.
words.example: The complicated directions confused me.

words.definition: If something is due, it is expected to happen at a certain time.
words.example: The baby is due in October.

words.definition: Entire means the whole of something.
words.example: He ate the entire pizza by himself.

words.definition: To establish something means to create it.
words.example: The company was established in 1990.

words.definition: A furnace is a large heater for a whole building.
words.example: The furnace keeps the house warm in the winter.

words.definition: A leash is a rope or chain used to lead a dog.
words.example: Keep your dog on a leash when you go for a walk.

words.definition: To mature means to become fully grown.
words.example: Children mature at different rates.

words.definition: To measure means to find the size or amount of something.
words.example: We measured the room before buying a new rug.

words.definition: The midst of something is the middle part of it.
words.example: We were in the midst of dinner when the phone rang.

words.definition: Misery is a feeling of great sadness.
words.example: The loss of his job caused him great misery.

words.definition: Prior means happening before something else.
words.example: I had a prior engagement, so I couldn't go to the party.

words.definition: Research is the study of something to find out new information.
words.example: The scientist is doing research on a new medicine.

words.definition: A variety is a number of different kinds of things.
words.example: There is a wide variety of flowers in the garden.
